instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPDCIN and PPBUS G3H rise and fall
threads.message:
Board never starts. 

Removed F7040 and both PPBUS and PPDCIN rise and drop. At first I thought was related to TPS chip being PPBUS is sometimes 12.65V and drops but if the DCIN is rolling from 16V and dropping, different issue I'm guessing?

No shorts on any of the coils and made sure to check L7220/60.

SHould I be focusing on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> for the issues or would that not also cause PPDCIN to rise and fall also?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPDCIN and PPBUS G3H rise and fall
threads.message:
Test with fake charger, or lab PSU and 60W cable.
Possibly input leakage issue; many times caused by <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>/85.
